{{also|仆射}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=仆射}}

===Etymology===
[[僕]] (in [[charge]] of) + [[射]] ([[archery]] [[weapons]])
: In the beginning of the [[w:Qin Dynasty|Qin Dynasty]], skilled archers were highly prized, and often given positions of responsibility within the government. By the [[w:Han Dynasty|Han Dynasty]], the púyè became assistants to prominant ministers (such as the ''[[w:Government of the Han Dynasty|Minister Steward]]''). By the [[w:Tang Dynasty|Tang Dynasty]], the power of the púyè rivaled that of the [[w:Chancellor of China|Imperial Chancellor]]'s. Subsequently, the position of púyè was phased out.

# {{lb|zh|archaic}} position title: [[executive]] [[assistant]]; [[deputy]] [[minister]] (to the ''[[w:Government of the Han Dynasty|Minister Steward]]'' etc.)

===Usage notes===
The character [[射]] is almost always pronounced shè in Mandarin. This is one of the very few compounds where it is pronounced yè.
